questions.question: 1. Which of the following is NOT a role in the Scrum Framework?
options: Scrum Master
Product Owner
Development Team
Project Manager
questions.correct_answer: Project Manager
questions.explanation: The Scrum Framework does not have a role for a Project Manager. Instead, the responsibilities of a Project Manager are distributed among the other roles, such as the Scrum Master and the Product Owner.

questions.question: 2. Which of the following is a key principle of the Scrum Framework?
options: Deliver incrementally, with continuous feedback
Optimize the whole
Manage flow
Enable self-organization
questions.correct_answer: Deliver incrementally, with continuous feedback
questions.explanation: One of the key principles of the Scrum Framework is to deliver incrementally, with continuous feedback. This principle emphasizes the importance of delivering value to the customer early and often, and of using feedback to guide the development process.

questions.question: 3. Which of the following is a key component of the Scrum Framework?
options: Product Backlog
Project Plan
Requirements Document
Use Case Diagram
questions.correct_answer: Product Backlog
questions.explanation: The Product Backlog is a key component of the Scrum Framework. It is a prioritized list of features or requirements that the Development Team works on during the Sprint.

questions.question: 4. What is the recommended duration of a Sprint in the Scrum Framework?
options: 2 weeks
4 weeks
6 weeks
8 weeks
questions.correct_answer: 2 weeks
questions.explanation: The recommended duration of a Sprint in the Scrum Framework is 2 weeks. This allows the team to deliver value to the customer frequently and to use feedback to guide the development process.

questions.question: 5. Which of the following is a key responsibility of the Scrum Master in the Scrum Framework?
options: Managing the Product Backlog
Providing technical guidance to the Development Team
Facilitating the Scrum Events
Making decisions about the product
questions.correct_answer: Facilitating the Scrum Events
questions.explanation: One of the key responsibilities of the Scrum Master in the Scrum Framework is to facilitate the Scrum Events, such as the Sprint Review and the Sprint Retrospective. The Scrum Master is also responsible for ensuring that the Scrum Framework is understood and followed by the team.

questions.question: 6. Which of the following is a key responsibility of the Product Owner in the Scrum Framework?
options: Managing the Sprint Backlog
Providing technical guidance to the Development Team
Prioritizing the Product Backlog
Facilitating the Daily Scrum
questions.correct_answer: Prioritizing the Product Backlog
questions.explanation: One of the key responsibilities of the Product Owner in the Scrum Framework is to prioritize the Product Backlog. The Product Owner is also responsible for ensuring that the team understands the product vision and the requirements, and for making decisions about the product based on feedback from stakeholders.

questions.question: 7. Which of the following is a key responsibility of the Development Team in the Scrum Framework?
options: Creating the Product Backlog
Providing technical guidance to the Product Owner
Delivering a potentially releasable Increment at the end of each Sprint
Facilitating the Sprint Review
questions.correct_answer: Delivering a potentially releasable Increment at the end of each Sprint
questions.explanation: One of the key responsibilities of the Development Team in the Scrum Framework is to deliver a potentially releasable Increment at the end of each Sprint. The Development Team is also responsible for self-organizing and managing its own work, and for continuously improving its processes and practices.

questions.question: 8. What is the purpose of the Sprint Review in the Scrum Framework?
options: To plan the work that will be done in the next Sprint
To inspect and adapt the process and the product
To review the progress of the project with stakeholders
To prioritize the Product Backlog
questions.correct_answer: To inspect and adapt the process and the product
questions.explanation: The purpose of the Sprint Review in the Scrum Framework is to inspect and adapt the process and the product. During the Sprint Review, the team demonstrates the Increment that was developed during the Sprint and receives feedback from stakeholders, which is used to guide the next Sprint.

questions.question: 9. What is the purpose of the Sprint Retrospective in the Scrum Framework?
options: To plan the work that will be done in the next Sprint
To inspect and adapt the process and the product
To review the progress of the project with stakeholders
To prioritize the Product Backlog
questions.correct_answer: To inspect and adapt the process and the product
questions.explanation: The purpose of the Sprint Retrospective in the Scrum Framework is to inspect and adapt the process and the product. During the Sprint Retrospective, the team reflects on the previous Sprint and identifies opportunities for improvement, which are used to guide the next Sprint.

questions.question: 10. Which of the following is a key benefit of the Scrum Framework?
options: Improved communication and collaboration
Reduced time-to-market
Improved product quality
All of the above
questions.correct_answer: All of the above
questions.explanation: The Scrum Framework provides several key benefits, including improved communication and collaboration, reduced time-to-market, and improved product quality. By using a time-boxed iterative approach and by focusing on delivering value to the customer early and often, the Scrum Framework enables teams to be more responsive to changing requirements and to deliver high-quality products in a more efficient manner.

questions.question: 11. Which of the following is a characteristic of a well-written Product Backlog?
options: It is detailed and includes all possible requirements
It is ordered by priority and reflects the customer's needs
It is managed by the Development Team and the Scrum Master
It is updated only at the end of each Sprint
questions.correct_answer: It is ordered by priority and reflects the customer's needs
questions.explanation: A well-written Product Backlog is ordered by priority and reflects the customer's needs. This enables the team to focus on delivering the most valuable features first and to use feedback to guide the development process. The Product Backlog should also be updated and refined continuously, not just at the end of each Sprint.

questions.question: 12. What is the purpose of the Daily Scrum in the Scrum Framework?
options: To plan the work for the day
To inspect and adapt the process and the product
To review the progress of the project with stakeholders
To prioritize the Product Backlog
questions.correct_answer: To plan the work for the day
questions.explanation: The purpose of the Daily Scrum in the Scrum Framework is to plan the work for the day. During the Daily Scrum, the Development Team members share their progress, identify any obstacles or risks, and plan their work for the next 24 hours. The Daily Scrum is a time-boxed event that should not exceed 15 minutes.

questions.question: 13. Which of the following is a characteristic of a well-functioning Development Team in the Scrum Framework?
options: They have a dedicated Project Manager to guide their work
They are cross-functional and self-organizing
They are managed and directed by the Product Owner
They have a fixed set of tasks to complete in each Sprint
questions.correct_answer: They are cross-functional and self-organizing
questions.explanation: A well-functioning Development Team in the Scrum Framework is cross-functional and self-organizing. This means that the team has all the necessary skills and competencies to deliver a potentially releasable Increment, and that it manages its own work and processes. The Development Team is also responsible for continuously improving its practices and for adapting to changing requirements and feedback.

questions.question: 14. Which of the following is a potential risk of using the Scrum Framework?
options: The team may be too focused on delivering individual features, rather than on delivering a cohesive product
The team may become too self-organizing and lose sight of the project goals
The Product Owner may become too controlling and micromanage the Development Team
The Scrum Master may become too prescriptive and rigid in the implementation of the Scrum Framework
questions.correct_answer: The team may be too focused on delivering individual features, rather than on delivering a cohesive product
questions.explanation: One potential risk of using the Scrum Framework is that the team may become too focused on delivering individual features, rather than on delivering a cohesive product. This can lead to a lack of integration and coherence in the product, and can make it difficult to deliver value to the customer. The Product Owner and the Scrum Master should work with the team to ensure that the product vision and the customer needs are always the primary focus.

questions.question: 15. What is the purpose of the Sprint Goal in the Scrum Framework?
options: To define the scope of the Sprint
To provide a high-level objective for the Sprint
To specify the technical tasks that must be completed in the Sprint
To prioritize the Product Backlog
questions.correct_answer: To provide a high-level objective for the Sprint
questions.explanation: The purpose of the Sprint Goal in the Scrum Framework is to provide a high-level objective for the Sprint. The Sprint Goal should be defined by the Product Owner and should reflect the customer needs and the product vision. The Sprint Goal should guide the work of the Development Team during the Sprint and should be reviewed and revised as necessary during the Sprint Review.

questions.question: 16. Which of the following is a characteristic of a well-written Sprint Backlog in the Scrum Framework?
options: It is detailed and includes all possible tasks
It is managed by the Scrum Master
It is updated only at the end of each Sprint
It is a plan that the Development Team creates to achieve the Sprint Goal
questions.correct_answer: It is a plan that the Development Team creates to achieve the Sprint Goal
questions.explanation: A well-written Sprint Backlog in the Scrum Framework is a plan that the Development Team creates to achieve the Sprint Goal. It should include all the tasks that the Development Team has identified as necessary to deliver the Sprint Goal, but should not include unnecessary details or tasks. The Sprint Backlog should be updated and refined continuously throughout the Sprint.

questions.question: 17. What is the purpose of the Sprint Burndown Chart in the Scrum Framework?
options: To show the progress of the project with stakeholders
To track the team's capacity and velocity
To measure the team's adherence to the Scrum Framework
To visualize the team's progress during the Sprint
questions.correct_answer: To visualize the team's progress during the Sprint
questions.explanation: The purpose of the Sprint Burndown Chart in the Scrum Framework is to visualize the team's progress during the Sprint. The Sprint Burndown Chart shows how much work remains to be done in the Sprint, and how quickly the team is progressing toward the Sprint Goal. The Sprint Burndown Chart can help the team to identify any issues or risks and to adapt its work accordingly.

questions.question: 18. Which of the following is a key principle of the Agile Manifesto?
options: Working software over comprehensive documentation
Processes and tools over individuals and interactions
Following a plan over responding to change
Customer satisfaction through contract negotiation
questions.correct_answer: Working software over comprehensive documentation
questions.explanation: One of the key principles of the Agile Manifesto is to value working software over comprehensive documentation. This principle emphasizes the importance of delivering value to the customer through a working product, rather than through extensive documentation or planning. The Agile Manifesto also values individuals and interactions over processes and tools, and responding to change over following a plan.

questions.question: 19. Which of the following is a key benefit of the Scrum Framework for the Product Owner?
options: Increased visibility into the development process
Reduced time-to-market
Improved collaboration with stakeholders
Greater control over the Development Team
questions.correct_answer: Increased visibility into the development process
questions.explanation: One of the key benefits of the Scrum Framework for the Product Owner is increased visibility into the development process. The Scrum Framework provides the Product Owner with regular opportunities to review the product Increment and to provide feedback to the Development Team. This enables the Product Owner to stay informed about the status of the project and to make informed decisions about the product.

questions.question: 20. Which of the following is a key benefit of the Scrum Framework for the Development Team?
options: Greater control over the project
Reduced time-to-market
Improved collaboration with stakeholders
Increased focus on delivering value to the customer
questions.correct_answer: Increased focus on delivering value to the customer
questions.explanation: One of the key benefits of the Scrum Framework for the Development Team is increased focus on delivering value to the customer. The Scrum Framework emphasizes the importance of delivering a potentially releasable Increment at the end of each Sprint, which enables the team to receive feedback from the customer and to adapt its work accordingly. By focusing on delivering value to the customer early and often, the Development Team can be more responsive to changing requirements and can deliver high-quality products in a more efficient manner.
